results.title: The Liners
results.creator_credit: Peter Butt, Rob McAuley, ABC-TV (Australia) and Channel Four
results.brief_description: Ocean liners were far more than simply giant ships that carried passengers across the seas. They were bold statements of national power and technological might. Like rocket ships in the space race of the 1970s, liners were symbols of ultimate power in the early struggle between the super-powers for dominance of the world. For the first time, the global story of these great ships - an epic story inextricably linked with epic world events is told. From the earliest days of the paddle-wheeled superliner; through their use in times of war as well as peace; into the present, and beyond, for a preview of giant ocean going cities already in the advance planning stages.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Butt, Rob McAuley, ABC-TV (Australia) and Channel Four

results.title: The Linear accelerator
results.brief_description: Using animation, this film introduces the theory of nuclear transmutations and the production of hard X-rays with laboratory-accelerated particles.

results.title: The Line
results.creator_credit: Christopher McGill, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Made to commemorate the first crossing of Australia by the standard gauge railway line between Sydney and Perth. It does not attempt to trace this trip, rather capture the spirit of the crossing, to the accompaniment of a folk song and natural sounds.

results.title: The Lindsay Kemp Circus
results.creator_credit: Douglas Eadie, Oscar Marzaroli and Contemporary Films
results.brief_description: Presents Lindsay Kemp, the most accomplished mime artist to emerge from Britain, his extraordinary co-star Orlando and their troupe. The film reflects the “lush decadence” of their work - Kemp performing the ultimate tatty striptease and Orlando singing “I Must Have A Man”.

results.title: The Lighthouse keeper
results.creator_credit: Lionel Trainor, R. Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A fascinating study of a lighthouse-keeper and his family, who tend one of the vital beacons in the storm-tossed waters south of Tasmania - on Maatsuyker Island. The film is outstanding for its treatment of the duties of the lighthouse-keeper, whose life is governed entirely by the light. Photography by Geoffrey Powell; music by Robert W. Hughes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lionel Trainor, R. Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board

results.title: The Lighthouse
results.brief_description: The opening sequences of this film remind us that the British Isles lie in one of the storm belts of the world, where fog is also a shipping hazzard; animation shows the large number of lighthouses all round British shores. Their position is shown in relation to shipping lanes, and the traffic in these lanes, and in relation to the chief ports. The life of the lighthouse keeper, and his duties, are also dealt with in detail.

results.title: The Light fantastick
results.creator_credit: Michel Patenaude, Rupert Glover, Wolf Koenig and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A detailed retrospective of the animation film at the National Film Board of Canada, of the techniques employed, and of the men and women who used and sometimes invented them. Documentary footage explains the techniques, and clips from NFB films illustrate the often spectacular results. Topics include Norman McLaren, hand-drawn-on-film and pixillation techniques, the “sing-along” animated songs of the 1940s, Alexandre Alexeieff’s pinscreen, and Evelyn Lambart’s fairytale improvisations. (Awards: New York; San Francisco; Salerno.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michel Patenaude, Rupert Glover, Wolf Koenig and ONF | NFB

results.title: The Life story of the tawny owl
results.brief_description: Shows the hatching and rearing of young tawny owls as well as various other animal life who share the woods with the owls. Includes long-eared owls, badgers and polecats.
